intro: Bartsia fagonii, commonly known as the Fagon's bartsia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to parts of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky areas. Its small, bilaterally symmetrical flowers are often pink or purple and attract various pollinators. Bartsia fagonii is characterized by its distinctive leaf structure and its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
